repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
### Problem

Documentation for editorconfig is hand maintained in vimdoc.

### Solution

Generate the vimdoc documentation from code annotations in the source code (`runtime/lua/editorconfig.lua`).

comment_data.body: Sorry to be a PITA, but could you please explain this change?
Why add this empty new line at the beginning of code blocks? Is it intended?

Not for this PR, but it would be a good idea of matching `.contains` checks to their respective documentation. This kind of "foo can only be one of [...] types` can easily (and unintentionally) become outdated.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +40,48 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
- vim:tw=78:ts=8:et:sw=4:ft=help:norl:
+
+                                                     *editorconfig-properties*
+
+The following properties are supported by default:
+
+
+charset                                                 *editorconfig.charset*

comment_data.body: Should we keep the convention of prefixing private methods with an underscore?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -215,11 +271,11 @@ local function parse(filepath, dir)
   return opts
 end
 
---- Configure the given buffer with options from an .editorconfig file
----
----@param bufnr integer Buffer number to configure
----
----@private
+local M = {}
+
+--- @private

comment_data.body: Ehh again: In some places new blank lines were added, and here they were removed. Were all these changes intentional?

I made a minor change in text_utils.lua to not strip newlines in code blocks.

The stripping was added in the initial commit for text_utils.lua to minimise the diff.
Sorry I don't understand. Did you mean to comment in a different line. (I'm on mobile)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +40,48 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
- vim:tw=78:ts=8:et:sw=4:ft=help:norl:
+
+                                                     *editorconfig-properties*
+
+The following properties are supported by default:
+
+
+charset                                                 *editorconfig.charset*

comment_data.body:
Maybe. Arguably this function isn't actually private though so I left it as is for now.

I'm not sure if these needs either `@nodoc` or `@package`, or something else entirely.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -215,11 +271,11 @@ local function parse(filepath, dir)
   return opts
 end
 
---- Configure the given buffer with options from an .editorconfig file
----
----@param bufnr integer Buffer number to configure
----
----@private
+local M = {}
+
+--- @private

comment_data.body:
The ones in the source were intentional so there are no diffs in the vimdoc files.

I left the ones in iter.lua as they look intentional.

Nope, this is the right line.

What I meant is that there are a lot of functions that have something like "`foo` should be one of `a`, `b` or `c`", and the function has some kind of check with `vim.validate`. I'm just pointing out how the documentation of those functions might get out of sync with the actual valid inputs.

But after writing this down I realize that it will be hard to add a generated check for those because it would depend on the function implementation, so ignore me lol.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -86,4 +40,48 @@ Example: >lua
       vim.b[bufnr].foo = val
     end
 <
- vim:tw=78:ts=8:et:sw=4:ft=help:norl:
+
+                                                     *editorconfig-properties*
+
+The following properties are supported by default:
+
+
+charset                                                 *editorconfig.charset*

comment_regular_data.body: (in the risk of being hated by all of core) @lewis6991 could you please add a description to this PR explaining the problem and/or solution that this PR addresses?
I think this is now generated instead of being handwritten; changes are a fallout of that.

> (in the risk of being hated by all of core) @lewis6991 could you please add a description to this PR explaining the problem and/or solution that this PR addresses? 

Done

This commit seems broken editorconfig, last commit build 09a919f313 is ok.

`cd some_dir_with_dot_editorconfig && nvim .editorconfig`:

.editorconfig:

```
root = true

[*.lua]
tab_width = 2
indent_size = 2
indent_style = space
```

title: docs(editorconfig): move to source
